Title: Senior Analyst, Supplier Onboarding Operations
RoleDescription:
Wayfair is the destination for all things home and a place that helps everyone, anywhere, create their feeling of home. Through technology and innovation, we make it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 33 million items across home furnishings, dcor, home improvement, housewares, and 23,000 Suppliers, and we served 24 million customers in 2021 alone. 
This "Get Started and Grow" team role collaborates closely with key stakeholders across Technology, Operations, and Commercial divisions to streamline and enhance the supplier onboarding experience and foster sustainable business growth. As a team member, you will play a pivotal role in driving strategic product enhancements, optimizing operational processes, and implementing data-driven analytical solutions that elevate both supplier support and overall customer satisfaction. The ideal candidate for this role is highly motivated, possesses a meticulous attention to detail, and demonstrates a global perspective in their approach to problem-solving and decision-making.
What You'll Do:

Collaborate cross functionally on a global scale with product, engineering, operations, and commercial teams to deliver initiatives to build the foundation for analytical framework as well as provide near term analysis to improve business impact, and experience for customers and suppliers
Perform deep-dive analysis on business impact, supplier/customer experience KPIs by leveraging analytics to identify root causes behind performance issues and provide insights around major pain points or other factors 
Communicate findings with a succinct point of view and utilize compelling visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Data Studio, Tableau, etc.) for both executive level as well as cross-functional team level stakeholder management
Use quantitative and qualitative skill sets to work with large and complex datasets, analyze ambiguous questions and develop recommendations to guide business decisions with senior leadership
Partner with business and engineering stakeholders at various levels to identify key factors and requirements for each initiative, secure the neccessary buy-in from leadership for project methodology, and build a 6-12 month roadmap with clear goals and milestones
Conduct business analysis via impact sizing, cost-benefit analysis, risk assessment, and other informed decision making methodologies

What You'll Need: 

Bachelors degree in Business, Supply Chain/Operations, or Engineering discipline
3+ years of experience in operations, retail, engineering, consulting, strategy or finance
Experience working in a program/project management setting is preferred; project or program management certification not required but is a plus
Strong written and verbal communication skill with a focus on stakeholder management
Experience communicating with technical teams on tech product related topics (tech bug escalations, product roadmaps, business requirements, etc.)
Self-starter with a high attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
Solid experience with Google or Microsoft Office tools is required
Proficiency with SQL (GBQ), or other database management of equal complexity is recommended, with at least 1-2 years of hands-on experience

An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy:

All Boston-based interns, Co-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday - Thursday, and work remotely Friday.

RoleDescription:
(Non people management role)
Contract: Full Time/ Remote
Location: UK/ Ireland or North America based
Travel: Minimum 50% Global Travel
Turn Vendor Relationships into Customer Wins
At Wayfair, we dont just sell home goodswe deliver exceptional experiences. Our award-winning Customer Service & Sales Teams are the heart of that mission, blending cutting-edge technology with genuine human empathy to build trust and loyalty with every interaction. From the moment an order is placed to the delivery at a customers door, were dedicated to making shopping for the home seamless, personal, and enjoyable- via phone, email, chat or social media.

Proficient understanding of how, and when, to leverage supporting tools & systems to achieve measurable business improvements

Title: Senior Manager, European Transportation Procurement
RoleDescription:
Location: Office Based London
Working Hours: 40hour per week (Monday-Friday)
People Management Role: No
Benefits Include: Wayfair Employee Discount, Private Medical Care, Dental Care, Gym Membership, Tuition Reimbursement, 25 Days starting Holiday (with tenure entitlement) + Bank Holidays, Pension, Cycle to Work scheme amongst others.
Drive Strategic Impact in European Transportation
Designing a supply chain that delivers at scale!
Senior Manager, European Transportation Procurement! Take a leading role in shaping the future of our transportation network across the region. In this highly strategic position, youll manage end-to-end carrier relationshipsfrom first mile supplier collections to last mile deliveryfor both small and large parcels within the UK and Ireland.
As part of our dynamic Global Transportation & Delivery team, you'll drive contract negotiations, lead RFPs, and ensure high-performing, cost-effective carrier partnerships. Your key focus will be leading procurement and commercial strategy across all transportation modes within the UKcovering first mile supplier collections, middle mile truckload, and last mile small and large parcel delivery. Youll also support cross-border carrier relationships and flows from Europe and Poland into the UK and Ireland, ensuring international operations are efficient and well-integrated into the broader network.
If you're ready to make a major impact, energized by innovation and thrive in a fast-paced, global environment; this may be the next adventure youve been seeking.
 
What You'll Do:

Develop and execute regional carrier sourcing strategies aligned with Wayfairs growth and service goals.
Identify and qualify new carrier partners across first, middle, and last mile segments.
Lead carrier RFPs, rate negotiations, and contract renewals across the UK and Europe.
Own end-to-end commercial relationships with transportation providers.
Ensure competitive pricing while improving service levels and operational flexibility.
Collaborate with internal partners to resolve billing discrepancies, contract disputes, and claims issues.
Manage carrier invoicing processes, dispute resolution, and payment integrity.
Monitor and benchmark carrier performance metrics (cost, speed, quality, reliability).
Provide insights and recommendations for continuous improvement and cost savings.
Partner with Logistics Operations, Supply Chain, Finance, Legal, and Technology teams to drive carrier initiatives.
Support new transportation programs and service expansion projects across the region.

 
What You'll Need:

Demonstrable experience in transportation procurement, carrier management, or logistics operations, ideally within the e-commerce, retail or home market. Any high-volume/ large parcel shipping understanding would be advantageous.
A proven track record of managing cross-border shipping operations, including transit time reduction, maximising truckloads, parcel & large parcel carriers, and optimising costs.
Comprehensive knowledge of UK and European transportation networks, regulatory environments, and carrier markets.
Clear understanding of contract law and logistics compliance requirements across the UK and EU.
Capability to work autonomously, apply strategic thinking, and lead projects from initial concept through to successful implementation.
Expertise in negotiating complex transportation contracts, leading RFP processes and utilising e-sourcing or procurement tools (e.g., Jaggaer, Coupa, Ariba).
Exceptional analytical and financial acumen, with the ability to assess transportation costs and carrier performance.
Effective relationship management skills, someone who collaborates effectively with both external partners and internal stakeholders.
Capability to leverage Excel and Google Sheets for complex tasks involving formulas, pivot tables, and large datasets. Familiarity with tools such as GBQ,SQL or Looker is advantageous.
Proficiency in navigating IT systems, tools and platforms simultaneously (eg: Google Suite/ Microsoft Office)

Travel Requirements
Although this role is predominantly office based, a flexibility to:

Travel to UK & Ireland Wayfair Depots, Fulfilment Centres, Supplier pickup sites and Carrier sites (approximately 10-15%), & 
Wider EU & Boston travel (approximately 2- 3 trips per year).

 
Apply now and make your next move your most impactful one yet at Wayfair.

Title: Graduate Finance Associate
RoleDescription:
Finance Graduate Programme at Wayfair, Galway 
Shopping for home is often overwhelming. Wayfair is an extreme case - its visited by two million people daily, shopping across more than 10 million products: Home furnishings, dcor, home improvement, housewares, and more. We work hard to conceal the complexity of this experience. 
Every customer should come away feeling like theyve found the perfect item for them. Shopping for the home should be exciting, and were the team that makes that happen. The team is responsible for liaising with suppliers & internal stakeholders, such as category managers and supplier operations to ensure that all invoices are compliant, good quality and processed for payment. To ensure a seamless customer experience, the team handles payments to suppliers to ensure that orders are being processed and are ready to be delivered to our customers. Due to an in-house built system, the team can consistently implement new enhancements and updates. 
Who we are
Our Global Finance Operations team is responsible for the core day to day financial activities that drive the business for our Customers, Suppliers and our Freight network. This group is responsible for the timely and accurate processing of orders, invoices, billing and payments including month end and all stakeholder support. This function is key to the overall success of the operations. 
Being an Graduate in Wayfairs Finance team 
As a Graduate, you will be assigned a dedicated mentor, who along with the wider finance team will ensure you are extensively trained and professionally developed so that you can meaningfully support our experienced team with a variety of day to day tasks, as well as project work. While we expect that there will be concentration in areas such as accounts payable, accounts receivable, accruals and audits, we will ensure that you are afforded exposure to all aspects of our core processes and systems to gain an understanding of all elements of the groups functions. 
Here is some information on what you may do depending on which team you join through supporting one or more of our financial teams with their work.
Financial Operations Graduate 

Work in close collaboration with direct teams onshore and offshore 
Assist and Support various Accounts Payable or Accounts Receivable processes either in the Product or Non-Product teams
Research and resolve invoice/billing discrepancies 
Assist in the preparation of daily payment runs via bank transfer
Monthly reconciliations of supplier/carrier accounts 
Assist with Billing, Collections and Cash Application 
Manage core data changes in system  
Research and resolve invoice discrepancies and issues
Monitor processes for accuracy - [discounts, allowances, rebates, pay terms]
Correspond with Suppliers/Carriers and respond within agreed SLAs 
Support month end process and assist as needed

 
What You'll Need

Excellent interpersonal skills and team player 
Excellent documentation and communication skills; fluent in English, written and verbal
Experience with MS Office, with excellent knowledge of Excel;
Pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
Experience with automation scripting is an advantage (Excel VBA or Python or R).
Ability to identify the most efficient ways to complete assigned tasks.
Desire to always learn, and a collaborative team-player attitude.
Knowledge & experience of Excel Data Model, Power Query advantageous.
Previous experience in accounting, financial modeling is an advantage but not essential.
Bachelors Degree, preferably in Business or Finance; 
Exceptional attention to detail
Self-motivated individual
Passionate about your work and always aiming to improve processes; 
An ability to manage multiple priorities and ensure that deadlines are consistently met

Title: Category Management Internship
RoleDescription:
Kickstart Your Career with Wayfairs Category Management Internship
Location: London | Duration: 6 months | Full-time Internship
At Wayfair, we believe everyone should live in a home they love. We're transforming the way people shop for their homes through cutting edge technology, a customer-first mindset, and an unmatched product selection. With millions of items in home furnishings, dcor, housewares, and more, we make it easy for shoppers to find exactly what theyre looking for.
Nows your chance to join our team as a Category Management Intern  and gain hands-on experience at one of the worlds most innovative eCommerce companies.
 What is Category Management at Wayfair?
Category Management is where business strategy meets customer experience. Each team owns a product category - like lighting, dcor, kitchen, or bedding, and acts as the business owner for that area. We work closely with suppliers, analyse performance, grow our selection and shape how customers interact with products on-site.
As an intern, youll be fully immersed in this world, working with real data, solving real problems, and driving real impact.
 What You'll Do
While your exact role will depend on your interests and team match, heres a glimpse of what you could be working on:


Build Relationships: Collaborate with suppliers and internal teams to keep your category thriving.


Spot Opportunities: Research new vendors and product trends to expand our selection and boost performance.


Drive Innovation: Test new ideas, launch experiments, and turn insights into action.


Own Projects: Take the lead on key initiatives, from pricing strategies to promotional planning.


Analyse & Optimize: Use data and web analytics tools to monitor success and identify areas for improvement.


Strategise & Scale: Support the rollout of category growth plans with merchandising, marketing, and operations teams.


 What Youll Need to Succeed


Fluency in English, both written and spoken.


Strong communication and collaboration skills  you enjoy working in teams.


A proactive, can-do attitude  youre quick to learn and not afraid to take initiative.


Ability to multitask and stay organized in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment.


Attention to detail with the ability to work independently.


An interest in eCommerce, retail, or home & lifestyle products  passion goes a long way here!


Basic knowledge of Excel and a curiosity about working with data.


 Why Wayfair? Why Now?


Work at the heart of a global eCommerce leader, alongside top talent in the industry.


Gain real ownership from day one  your ideas will be heard, tested, and celebrated.


Get exposure to multiple business functions  from supply chain to marketing.


Receive hands-on mentorship to guide your growth and development.


Enjoy a vibrant, collaborative culture in our London office.

Wayfair leads e-commerce for all things home, driven by modern tech. We seek sharp thinkers who design scalable systems while keeping a startup mindset. Our culture values fast, data-driven innovation.

Title: Engineer I, Application Support
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Warehouse Application Support Engineer
Who We Are [Warehouse Application Support]
Wayfair.com is a leader in the e-commerce space for all things home. Our platforms support millions of people searching every day for the perfect item, and provide a unique purchase and delivery experience. Here at Wayfair, data drives everything that we do. Come help us continue to build innovative solutions, leading up to our next $10B in revenue!
Employee Tech at Wayfair is responsible for providing technology services and support for all Wayfairians globally. Our goal is to enable employee productivity through collaboration and innovation to help our employees provide our customers with a home that they love! Were looking to grow our Warehouse IT team by bringing on a talented individual who wants exposure to our broad desktop computing tech stack and complex technical warehouse infrastructure.

Create and maintain documentations
Analyze production or workflow issues by creating and running SQL queries or utilize our proprietary warehouse management system.
Prioritize tickets on ServiceNow to ensure our end users receive updates and resolutions in a timely manner.
Provide mentorship and training programs to other members of the team.
Ability to triage incidents, create PainScore and initiate PagerDuty incidents
Proactively seeks out ways to improve and drive one's own career development
Collaborate across cross functional engineering and business teams to solve high impact incidents with a sense of urgency by providing quality and accurate information.
Identify recurring technical issues and fix their root causes to enhance business productivity.

Title: Software Engineer II, Storefront
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfilment Optimisation team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimising for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfilment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
 
What You Will Do:

Flex your strength and knowledge on Java, DevOps, and microservices development.
Define and ensure services are built to industry best practices, including observability, architectural patterns, and inter-team dependency mechanisms (like SLOs)
Work closely with architects and other teams across Storefront to breakdown an existing PHP monolith into well defined Java Microservices with clean boundaries and clear API contracts
Serve as the local technical lead in the critical domain, designing & building a platform that interfaces with many different systems within and outside Wayfair and partner globally.
Architect and write code to implement high-quality, scalable, future-proof services that will have effective system boundaries and will support long-term vision & strategy
Conduct technical debate across an entire platform and help come to durable documented conclusions
Drive high-impact architectural solutions and hands-on development, including inception, design, execution, and delivery following good design and coding practices
Obsessively focus on production readiness for the team including testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation, and proactive troubleshooting
Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet the department's technical vision
Work closely with product managers, designers, and peer engineering teams to define project requirements and execution plans
 
We Are a Match Because You Have:
3+ years of experience in engineering, with a preference for candidates with a mix of start-up and large-company experience
eComm domain expertise is a bonus
Hands-on experience driving software transformations within high-growth environments at scale
Experienced in architecting and building large-scale, cloud-based, and event-driven systems across various projects
Excellent communication skills with demonstrated experience driving teams forward and ability to influence results
GCP target cloud platform, experience with AWS/Azure at scale
Distributed microservices architectures with well architected domain boundaries
High volume async messaging architectures
Large scale relational and NoSQL style data stores
Common open source platforms, tools and framework, eg: Kafka, Kubernetes, Containerization, Java microservices, GraphQL APIs, Aerospike etc.

Title: Senior Associate, Labor Planning
RoleDescription:

The Senior Associate of Labor Planning plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.

Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Preferred Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements

Title: ML Scientist, Advertising Optimization & Automation
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who we areWayfairs Advertising business is rapidly expanding, adding hundreds of millions of dollars in profits to Wayfair. We are building Sponsored Products, Display & Video Ad offerings that cater to a variety of Advertiser goals while showing highly relevant and engaging Ads to millions of customers. We are evolving our Ads Platform to empower advertisers across all sophistication levels to grow their business on Wayfair at a strong, positive ROI and are leveraging state of the art Machine Learning techniques.
The Advertising Optimization & Automation Science team is central to this effort. We leverage machine learning and generative AI to streamline campaign workflows, delivering impactful recommendations on budget allocation, target Return on Ad Spend (tROAS), and SKU selection. Additionally, we are developing intelligent systems for creative optimization and exploring agentic frameworks to further simplify and enhance advertiser interactions.
We are looking for Machine Learning Scientists to join the Advertising Optimization & Automation Science team. In this role, you will be responsible for the development of budget, tROAS and SKU recommendations and other machine learning capabilities supporting our ads business. You will work closely with other scientists, as well as members of our internal Product and Engineering teams, to apply your engineering and machine learning skills to solve some of our most impactful and intellectually challenging problems to directly impact Wayfairs revenue.
What youll do

Design, build, deploy and refine large-scale machine learning models and algorithmic decision-making systems that solve real-world problems for customers
Work cross-functionally with commercial stakeholders to understand business problems or opportunities and develop appropriately scoped analytical solutions
Collaborate closely with various engineering, infrastructure, and machine learning platform teams to ensure adoption of best-practices in how we build and deploy scalable machine learning services
Identify new opportunities and insights from the data (where can the models be improved? What is the projected ROI of a proposed modification?)
Be obsessed with the customer and maintain a customer-centric lens in how we frame, approach, and ultimately solve every problem we work on.

What youll need

3+ years of industry experience with a Bachelor/ Masters degree or minimum of 1-2 years of industry experience with PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field.
Proficiency in Python or one other high-level programming language
Solid hands-on expertise deploying machine learning solutions into production
Strong theoretical understanding of statistical models such as regression, clustering and machine learning algorithms such as decision trees, neural networks, etc.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Intellectual curiosity and enthusiastic about continuous learning

Nice to have

Experience with Python machine learning ecosystem (numpy, pandas, sklearn, XGBoost, etc.) and/or Apache Spark Ecosystem (Spark SQL, MLlib/Spark ML)
Familiarity with GCP (or AWS, Azure), machine learning model development frameworks, machine learning orchestration tools (Airflow, Kubeflow or MLFlow)
Experience in information retrieval, query/intent understanding, search ranking, recommender systems etc.
Experience with deep learning frameworks like PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.

Title: Senior Specialist, Logistics & Inventory Ops
RoleDescription:
Senior Specialist, Logistics & Inventory Ops - Wayfair Branded Stores
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091
Compensation starts at $21.00/hour for this role.
Overview:
As a Senior Specialist of Inventory & Logistics, youll play a critical role in driving operational excellence and ensuring seamless inventory and supply chain processes within Wayfairs Physical Retail store in Wilmette. Reporting to the Department Manager, youll lead key initiatives that optimize inventory accuracy, streamline logistics operations, and enhance overall store efficiency. Leveraging data-driven insights and problem-solving expertise, youll implement best practices that improve product availability, minimize discrepancies, and support a flawless customer shopping experience.
In this role, youll also mentor Logistics & Inventory Specialists, collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, and take ownership of projects that enhance store performance. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced, evolving environment, and has a strong background in inventory management and logistics, and is passionate about building scalable solutions that drive retail success.
What Does a Sr. Specialist of Inventory & Logistics Do?

Demonstrate Reliability & Professionalism: Maintain strong attendance and communication to support business needs. Proactively address scheduling or operational challenges to ensure consistent store coverage.
Lead Inventory Control & Accuracy: Own the Cycle Count Program and other inventory control initiatives to ensure accurate stock levels, minimize shrinkage, and optimize inventory flow. Analyze data trends to forecast demand and adjust inventory strategies accordingly.
Optimize Logistics & Supply Chain Operations: Evaluate and refine logistics processes to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and improve fulfillment speed. Implement best practices for shipment processing, stock replenishment, and overall supply chain coordination.
Oversee Shipment Processing & Vendor Coordination: Manage inbound and outbound shipments, ensuring accurate receiving, processing, and dispatch. Partner with vendors and distribution teams to resolve fulfillment discrepancies and improve delivery timelines.
Drive Operational Excellence & Compliance: Monitor adherence to inventory and logistics policies, conduct regular audits, and implement corrective actions to maintain high operational standards.
Mentor & Develop Logistics Team Members: Train and support Logistics & Inventory Specialists, providing guidance on best practices, troubleshooting challenges, and fostering a high-performance culture.
Analyze Performance & Drive Data-Driven Decisions: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to inventory, shipping, and logistics. Leverage insights to identify areas for improvement and make informed recommendations.
Ensure Cross-Functional Alignment: Collaborate with store leadership, merchandising, and operations teams to integrate logistics processes with broader business objectives. Provide insights to improve product availability and customer experience.
Solve Problems & Lead Continuous Improvement: Identify operational bottlenecks and implement innovative solutions to enhance workflow, accuracy, and efficiency in logistics operations.
Adapt to Rapid Change & Evolving Business Needs: Thrive in a fast-paced environment by staying agile, managing shifting priorities, and proactively addressing challenges as they arise.

What are the Job Requirements?

Education: Bachelors degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field preferred, or equivalent work experience.
Experience: 3-5 years of experience in inventory control, logistics, or supply chain operations, preferably in a retail environment. Experience leading projects, mentoring team members, and driving operational improvements.
Inventory & Logistics Expertise: Strong understanding of inventory management principles, logistics workflows, and best practices for stock accuracy and shipment processing. Experience with WMS systems and inventory tracking technology is a plus.
Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to analyze data, identify trends, and develop effective solutions to improve efficiency, accuracy, and cost-effectiveness.
Leadership & Collaboration: Proven ability to mentor, train, and develop team members while working cross-functionally with store leadership, merchandising, and operations teams.
Technical Proficiency: Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel) or Google Suite (especially Sheets). Familiarity with inventory management systems, order management tools, and scan technology preferred.
Physical Requirements: Ability to perform frequent movement, including standing, kneeling, crouching, and repetitive motions. Must be able to lift, carry, push, or pull up to 50 lbs as needed.
Availability: Open schedule availability, including nights, weekends, and holidays, is required.

Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
Ability to ascend/descend stairs and balance

Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team.  What Youll Do:

Facilitate technical debate and decision making with an appreciation for trade-offs
Continuously rethink and push the status quo, even when it challenges your/our established  ideas.

Results-oriented, collaborative, pragmatic, and continuous improvement mindset

Experience working with containers, container orchestration and deploy automation
12+ years of experience in engineering, out of which at least 3-6 years spent in leadinghighly performant teams .
Experience making architectural and design-related decisions for large scale platforms,understanding the tradeoffs between time-to-market vs. flexibility.

Title: Machine Learning Scientist -  Catalog Science Foundations
RoleDescription:
The Catalog Science Foundations team at Wayfair drives growth by tackling fundamental challenges ranging from multi-modal product understanding, product relationships modeling, to GenAI-driven catalog intelligence at scale. Our team provides the core capabilities that are crucial for enhancing the customer browse experience (e.g., visual search, recommendations), streamlining supplier product onboarding (e.g., product classification, image and content tagging), informing catalog competitiveness, and ultimately delivering significant impact for our customers, suppliers, and Wayfair.
We are looking for a strong Machine Learning Scientist with deep technical expertise and a proactive, action-oriented mindset. In this role, you will be instrumental in developing and refining the advanced models and systems that power our core mission. You will contribute to a diverse range of initiatives by applying cutting-edge deep learning techniques, vision-language models, and Generative AI agentic workflows. You will work in close collaboration with a highly capable, cross-functional team to tackle complex, high-impact challenges and help pioneer innovative solutions.
If you are passionate about working on cutting-edge AI problems, building scalable machine learning systems that solve real-world challenges, and directly contributing to significant business impact, this is the role for you.
What youll do:

Research and experiment with state-of-the-art multi-modal understanding techniques and algorithms. Design and implement evaluation strategies applied to real-world scenarios tailored to Wayfair use cases.
Leverage and fine-tune LLMs (e.g., OpenAI GPT, Google Gemini, Anthropic Claude, Open Source) to build AI-driven classifiers, product taggers, and quality control mechanisms.
Develop and refine the visual search system leveraging cutting edge technologies in computer vision, vision language models, and the large scale data orchestration.
Implement AI-powered automation for product data structuring, attribute extraction, and metadata validationensuring our catalog remains accurate, complete, and scalable.
Collaborate with top AI research and industry leaders (e.g., Google, Anthropic, Snorkel AI) to explore cutting-edge techniques in LLMs, data labeling automation, and scalable ML workflows.
Develop agentic AI workflows for automated schema definition, dataset generation, production relationship modeling, and LLM-based judgment systems to validate catalog data.
Partner with cross-functional teams across engineering, scientists, and product to ensure AI solutions integrate seamlessly into catalog systems.
Optimize cost, efficiency, and scalability of AI models, leveraging parameter-efficient fine-tuning (LoRA, QLoRA), knowledge distillation, and hybrid ML approaches.

Who you are:

PhD with 0-1+ years of experience or Masters in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related quantitative field with 2+ years of full-time industry experience in applied research.
Proven track record of delivering successful machine learning projects from conception to production, demonstrating strong deployment, problem-solving, and maintenance skills.
Deep understanding of both traditional Machine learning approaches and deep learning techniques, reinforcement learning, and multi-modal understanding. 
Deep understanding of LLMs, generative AI, and fine-tuning techniques, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques,  with hands-on experience using models like GPT, Gemini, Claude, etc.
Deep understanding of data engineering concepts with experience in building scalable data pipelines for collecting, processing, and transforming data.
Professional coding expertise in languages like Python and Go, proficiency in SQL, and experience with data visualization tools; skilled in using ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch) and implementing CI/CD, containerization, and version control best practices.
Familiarity with ML Ops, cloud infrastructure, and engineering best practices (Airflow, Kubeflow, MLFlow, Kubernetes, Spark, Python, SQL).
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders while collaborating across teams.
Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new tools and techniques in a fast-paced, evolving environment, while managing multiple priorities with a high level of attention to detail and staying current with the latest ML research.

Nice to have:

Research publications in deep learning, computer vision, or generative AI.
Experience working in e-commerce catalog AI systems, retail data structuring, or large-scale product classification.

You will collaborate with cross-functional partners in Category Management, Promotion Operations, Marketing, Brand, Creative, Merchandising Operations, Analytics and external Suppliers in order to shape and solidify the direction of your class. What Youll Do 

Build and maintain class assortment strategies, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering

Partner closely with Category Management, Suppliers, Creative, Marketing, Analytics and Brand to determine how best to bring the selection to life in both digital and print
Maintain a close pulse on trends and customer needs to identify new assortment opportunities.  Partner with category management and external suppliers when curating the line plan to find products that deliver compelling newness and tomorrows best sellers.
Own the financial outcomes for the performance of the products you placed on the premium shelf spaces. Regularly assess performance and revise assortment and shelf space allocation strategy as needed.  
Domestic Travel [4x / month] to our QC & Video Studio operation to ensure product experience
International Travel [1-2x / year] Attend industry trade shows relevant to your categories to partner with strategic suppliers and further optimize our catalog    

 
Who You Are

A bachelor's or masters degree
Experience buying or merchandising trend-driven categories, curating assortments from a wide range of vendors and classifications, and developing compelling assortment presentations are all highly preferred.
Strong ability to analyze data and think critically, understand and interpret performance trends, and apply learnings to the business  
Strong creative sense, elevated taste level, and love of product.  A genuine passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
Excellent communication/persuasion skills and ability to influence internal and external stakeholders to align behind and execute against a common goal
Capable of thriving in a high-growth environment in which defining clarity amidst ambiguity and operating in scrappy start-up building mode are everyday activities.  
Self-starter motivated by the potential to define a creative and strategic vision and have an outsized impact within a team and company
Ability to work from Wayfairs London office 4 days per week & 1 day a week remote. Sometimes at Wayfairs Verified Studio 1 day per week in Birmingham. Travel for competitor diligence & trade shows.

Title: Manager, Procurement Operations
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA (this role is not a virtual / remote position). 4 days in office/ 1 day WFH
Wayfair is looking for a Manager on our Procurement Product team to drive the ongoing optimization of our cloud-based procure-to-pay system and subsequent spend processes. This highly visible role is pivotal to standardizing our firm-wide buying process, improving our downstream financial operations, tracking spend data, unlocking process efficiencies, and maximizing our teams return on investment. We are looking for adaptable doers who are great at engaging with stakeholders, questioning inefficiencies, using data to solve problems, and multi-tasking. 
As the lead Product Manager, you will need to understand the needs of cross-functional partners across finance, accounting, engineering, and the business - then translate them into a product strategy and roadmap for our suite of Procurement tools, including Coupa, Contract Lifecycle Management, and Vendor Management System. You will need to be skilled at navigating a multitude of strong ideas, selecting the ones that will drive our agenda the furthest, and communicating the priorities back to our partners. As the internal expert and guru of our procure-to-pay systems, youll then roll up your sleeves with the Procurement Operations and partner teams to get the work done. 
You will bring a strong background in Product and/or Procurement best practices and help to drive the discovery effort of new features as well as the execution of ongoing ones. This role is ideal for someone who's both business and tech-savvy and thrives in a fast-paced environment. 
What You'll Do

Create and drive a roadmap aimed at revamping our procure-to-pay system, with a focus on results and the experience of users.
Partner with stakeholders and senior leaders across departments to understand needs, identify gaps in current processes, define product design and functional requirements, and implement a system roadmap to drive business impact.
Lead the implementation of a vendor management system.
Oversee system updates and manage the ongoing relationship with our vendor; coordinate associated change management efforts as necessary.
Develop and monitor functional performance metrics (KPIs) and devise/deploy strategies for ongoing program optimization.
Create reporting suite to distribute to category sourcing and cross-functional connections to highlight trends and opportunities to reduce spend through sourcing efforts, catalog enablement, and process improvement. 
Collaborate with engineering to review, prioritize, and action system enhancement requests and reconfigurations.

What You'll Need

4+ years experience in Product Management, procurement operations/sourcing, systems management, or strategy consultancy; experience with a cloud-based P2P system is a plus.
Bachelors degree required and preferred in an analytical field, such as economics, engineering, business, math, statistics, science, or analytics.
Ability to thrive in a high growth and entrepreneurial environment where strong project management skills and the ability to juggle multiple priorities are a must.
Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of employees and executive management.
Articulate and persuasive communication skills, both written and verbal.
A track record of successful relationship management skills.
An ability to hit the ground running and learn quickly; a self-starter.

Title: Workflow Control Manager - McDonough
RoleDescription:
The role plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site specific goals across Wayfair's Fulfillment Network. They work to ensure the accurate, timely, and cost efficient processing of the perfect order to our customers.
What You'll Do

Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

3+ years operational experience in distribution or manufacturing.
Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Capacity Planning experience or Industrial Engineering background focused on operations flow and labor management
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements

Title: Senior Manager, Profit Management & Pricing - Wayfair Canada
RoleDescription:

This role is pivotal in ensuring the long-term profitability of our business in the region by developing and executing effective pricing and investment strategies. Based in our Boston office, you will oversee a team of three talented analysts and collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive optimal financial performance.
Key Responsibilities

Pricing and Profit Margin Optimization:

Develop and implement pricing strategies to achieve optimal long-term profit margins for the Canada market.
Utilize levers such as margin setting, promotional pricing, and investment strategies to balance customer acquisition and profitability.
Drive branded pricing initiatives to align with supplier and market dynamics.

Strategic Planning and Forecasting:

Partner with the Finance team to lead profitability planning and forecasting efforts, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Contribute to scenario modeling and sensitivity analyses to guide strategic decision-making.

Collaborate with the Business Trends team to monitor and evaluate overall business performance, identifying risks and opportunities.
Develop actionable insights from pricing performance metrics to drive continuous improvement.

Be a voice of the Canadian business, working closely with Finance, Marketing, Supplier Partnerships and Operations teams to align on broader business goals, prioritize opportunities and drive action

Exceptional quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to distill complex data into actionable insights.

Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to navigate complex business challenges and drive results.

Demonstrated success in leading and developing teams, fostering a collaborative and inclusive environment.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working across diverse teams and levels of an organization.

Familiarity with e-commerce, retail, or consumer goods is a plus.

Title: Process, Audit and Jump Supervisor
RoleDescription:
Process, Audit, & Jump Supervisor - Global Transportation & Delivery
We are support partners and leaders on the Wayfair Global Supply Chain Transportation and Delivery Enablement Team.  We support our large parcel delivery locations, providing direct feedback & development to our Transportation & Delivery teams through onsite audits and training. We bring extensive process knowledge to our stakeholders and aid in the development of network-wide resources through process, audit, and training  initiatives and building audits to optimize performance and enhance employee engagement. We are culture enthusiasts throughout our entire Supply Chain network.  
We are looking for a proven leader to influence cross-functional teams responsible for development, standard work, and championing the Wayfair culture in our Middle Mile and Home Delivery Operations. The candidate must be a collaborative problem solver, strategic planner, and one who can manage & supervise high performing teams in a fast-paced, rapidly challenging, and fluid environment. 
Schedule:   

Hours for this position are five 8-hour shifts per week.
Monday - Friday 8AM-5PM, with flex to overnight shifts as needed
At times, will need to flex schedule days/times to support operational needs - including working overnight full night shifts, or working an alternate day (weekends).
Travel 75%  required, sometimes with short notice.

Location:

Role Location Options:  

City of Industry, CA
Linden, NJ
Pompano Beach, FL
Manassas, VA
Phoenix, AZ


What You'll Do

Perform regular audits of HDO Warehouses locations across the country as assigned, focusing on 5S standards and process compliance. 
Present audit findings with network leadership and provide feedback based on your onsite observations.
Follow up on previous audits to ensure that action plans have been successfully implemented.
Coordinate, lead, and execute all training functions HDO locations, including new hire orientation, job function training, new process & tech launches, and continuous development.
Lead various training sessions as needed, including but not limited to: New Hire Fundamentals, Powered Industrial Vehicle (PIV) training, Quality & Process (Current & New SOP) Training.
Use operational expertise to flex to support site operations during peak volume periods, and when needed.  Supervise the functions and working of warehouse workers while adhering to the compliance of all legal and safety procedures.
Work effectively with other managers within functional team and support new team members.
Support T&D Enablement, Safety, and Operations by championing training programs, processes, and initiatives; provide upward feedback and share observations with business owners to improve alignment, compliance, quality, and engagement.

What Youll Need

3+ years of experience in Supply Chain Leadership, Change Management OR 4 year degree in relevant field, required
Experience in Operations or Supply Chain preferred
Raymond and/or Crown forklift/powered industrial vehicle certifications preferred.  Willingness to be trained on multiple vehicle types required.
Leadership skills and the ability to make decisions with little or no guidance based on policies or best practices.
Exceptional written and verbal communication to effectively communicate with all stakeholder levels.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
A seek-to-understand mindset and teamwork strategies that will allow you to connect with and influence diverse groups of people, including your training audience and stakeholder network.
